required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Patterns of Use of REKOVELLE® in Naïve Women Undergoing In Vitro Fertilisation or Intracytoplasmic Sperm Injection Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Multicentre Non-Interventional Study to Assess the Patterns of Use of REKOVELLE® in Women Undergoing In Vitro Fertilisation or Intracytoplasmic Sperm Injection Procedures in Routine Clinical Practice

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to monitor the use in routine clinical practice of REKOVELLE®. This study will collect information from patients who never underwent previous in vitro fertilisation (IVF) or intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) treatments for up to three consecutive treatment cycles.
The ovarian stimulation protocol with REKOVELLE®, a new recombinant human Follicle Stimulating Hormone (FSH) prescribed for ovarian stimulation, is individualised with a dosing regimen that is based on two parameters: the body weight and the level of a hormone, the Anti Müllerian Hormone, (AMH), a parameter used to predict how the ovaries will respond to the ovarian stimulation.

primary_outcome.measure: Use of algorithm-based individualised dosing regimen to decide daily dose of REKOVELLE®
primary_outcome.time_frame: At consultation visit where the daily dose of REKOVELLE® is decided
primary_outcome.description: Calculated with body weight in kilograms or pounds and AMH serum level in pmoL/L or ng/ml to define the daily dose of REKOVELLE® in micrograms

primary_outcome.time_frame: At consultation visit where the daily dose of REKOVELLE® is decided
primary_outcome.description: Use of the Ferring developed dosing app for the daily dose calculation by answering yes/no to a questionnaire

primary_outcome.measure: Daily dose of REKOVELLE® in micrograms
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day 1 up to day 20 of REKOVELLE® stimulation

primary_outcome.measure: Number of days of treatment with REKOVELLE®
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day 1 up to day 20 of REKOVELLE® stimulation
primary_outcome.description: Adjusted during the stimulation based on blood sample of Oestrogen levels and number of follicles (at the discretion of the investigator)

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the day of the first REKOVELLE® injection during the ovarian stimulation treatment
primary_outcome.description: The time point of the start of the stimulation is decided at the discretion of the investigator

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the day of the last REKOVELLE® injection during the ovarian stimulation treatment
primary_outcome.description: The time point of the end of the stimulation is decided at the discretion of the investigator

primary_outcome.measure: Type of GnRH used for Lutenizing Hormone(LH) surge suppression
primary_outcome.time_frame: At consultation visit where the LH surge suppression protocol is decided
primary_outcome.description: Defined as a choice between GnRH agonist and GnRH antagonist

primary_outcome.measure: Day of LH surge suppression protocol start
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the day of the first GnRH administration during the ovarian stimulation treatment
primary_outcome.description: The time point of the start of LH surge suppression is decided at the discretion of the investigator

primary_outcome.measure: Day of LH surge suppression protocol end
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the day of the last GnRH administration during the ovarian stimulation treatment
primary_outcome.description: The time point of the end of LH surge suppression is decided at the discretion of the investigator

primary_outcome.measure: Type of drug used for the triggering of follicle maturation
primary_outcome.time_frame: At consultation visit where the triggering of follicle maturation protocol is decided
primary_outcome.description: Decided as a choice between hCG and/or GnRH

primary_outcome.measure: Date of administration of hCG and/or GnRH for follicle maturation
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the day of administration (at the discretion of the investigator)
primary_outcome.description: Date when the investigator decides to trigger the final follicle maturation

primary_outcome.measure: Type of drug used for Luteal phase support
primary_outcome.time_frame: From ovum pick-up day (the length of luteal phase support is decided at the discretion of the investigator)
primary_outcome.description: Decided as a choice between Progesterone, Oestrogene and hCG

primary_outcome.measure: Parameters used to define the daily dose of REKOVELLE® in case a new assisted reproductive technology treatment is initiated
primary_outcome.time_frame: At consultation visit where the ovarian stimulation treatment strategy is decided
primary_outcome.description: According to the Summary of Product Characteristics, the daily dose can be increased or decreased for subsequent cycles based on the patient response to the initial treatment cycle.

intervention.description: The Intervention (solution for injection) is delivered with an injection pen. The REKOVELLE® dose will be based on recent determination (within the last 12 months) of AMH (anti- müllerian hormone) measured by the following diagnostic test from ROCHE: ELECSYS AMH Plus immunoassay.

study_pop.textblock: Women who are prescribed REKOVELLE® within the approved indication for IVF or ICSI for their first in vitro fertilisation treatment will be invited to participate in the study. Patients will be enrolled only after the treatment decision has been made and no aspect of this study will interfere with or influence the routine medical procedures and/or medications received

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Patients who meet all of the following criteria are eligible for participation:
- Females are prescribed REKOVELLE® for their first in vitro fertilisation (IVF) or intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) treatment cycle using fresh or frozen ejaculated sperm from male partner or sperm donor
- Willing and able to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria: Patients who meet any of the following criteria are not eligible for participation:
- Patients who meet any of the following criteria are not eligible for participation:
- Participating in an interventional clinical trial in which any treatment or follow-up is mandated
- Women with a contraindication for prescription of REKOVELLE® treatment
- Oocyte donors
- Women undergoing ovarian stimulation for fertility preservation
